def fibonacci : Nat â†’ Nat
  | 0 => 0
  | 1 => 1
  | Nat.succ (Nat.succ n) => fibonacci (Nat.succ n) + fibonacci n
proof:
We induct on $n$:

\begin{itemize}
\item BC: $n=0$\\
Clearly:
\[0=1-1\]
\item BC: $n=1$\\
Clearly:
\[F_0=0=1-1 = (0+1)-1 = F_2-1\]

\item IH: Suppose that there exists $n\ge 0$ such that this holds.
\item IS: $n+1$\\
\[\sum_{i<n+1}F_i = F_{n} + \sum_{i<n}F_i = F_n + F_{n+1}-1 = F_{n+2}-1\]
\end{itemize}
Thus, we conclude via induction that:
$$\sum_{i < n} F_i = F_{n+1} - 1$$
